titles.title: A bill for the relief of Michael Wilding.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Immigration and Refugee Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden without amendment. With written report No. 100-507.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 936.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Immigration, Refugees, and International Law.
House Committee on The Judiciary Discharged by Unanimous Consent.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Message on House action received in Senate and held at desk: House amendment to Senate bill.

vote.text: Senate agreed to the House amendment by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 12/4/1987--Introduced. Declares a named individual to have been lawfully admitted to the United States for permanent residence under the Immigration and Nationality Act.
